title:
Efficient search of a minimum tree on points in a space with the
  $l_1$-norm
abstract:
In this paper, we consider the minimum spanning tree problem (for short,
MSTP) on an arbitrary set of $n$ points of $d$-dimensional space in $l_1$-norm.
For this problem, for each fixed $d\geq 2$, there is a known algorithm of the
computational complexity $O\big(n\cdot (\log\,n + \log^{r_d}\,n\cdot
\log\log\,n)\ big)$, where $r_d\in \{0,1,2,4\}$ for $d\in \{2,3,4,5\}$ and
$r_d=d$ for $d\geq 6$. For $d=3$, this result can be improved to the
computational complexity $O(n\cdot \log\,n)$. In this paper, for any fixed
$d\geq 2$, an algorithm with the computational complexity $O(n\cdot
\log^{d-1}\,n)$ is proposed to solve the considered MSTP, which improves the
previous achievement for $d\geq 6$.
